Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown-coloured pottery ribbed vessel, exterior covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains of six lines of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing an account of corn shipments.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.117)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87621) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87621)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 131 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
